alert.note: Alert for Northern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 02 at 3:48AM MST until December 02 at 12:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TODAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 3 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Northern High Plains adjacent to the Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until Noon MST today. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from Noon today to 3 PM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and drifting snow could lead to partial lane blockages. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and evening commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
